CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Criminal proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed (Article 41 - Causal link;Pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction);Non-pecuniary damage - award (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction)
TEXT: CARDINAL . On DATE preliminary investigations on the suspicion of murder were instituted against the applicant . On DATE a ORG ( Geschworenengericht ) at ORG ( PERSON ) convicted the applicant of murder and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment . On DATE ORG ( Oberster Gerichtshof ) dismissed the applicant 's plea of nullity and appeal against sentence .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested the re - opening of the criminal proceedings against him . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's request . On DATE ORG ( Oberlandesgericht ) granted the applicant 's appeal and reopened the criminal proceedings against him . At the same time the applicant was released .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG filed a bill of indictment charging the applicant with murder . On DATE ORG accepted the applicant 's objections to the indictment .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG filed a new bill of indictment against the applicant . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's objections to it .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed a request by ORG to transfer jurisdiction in the case to a court in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a request under LAW of LAW ( PERSON ) with ORG . He complained about the inactivity of ORG and requested ORG to order ORG to fix a date for the trial . On DATE ORG refused this request . ORG found that ORG had to wait for further expert opinions concerning a DNA test of hair and skin parts which had been found on the victim and the applicant ’s clothes .
CARDINAL . On DATE the DNA test results were transmitted to the court .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Presiding Judge of ORG fixed the date of the applicant 's trial for DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicant 's trial commenced on DATE and finished on DATE . On CARDINAL DATE ORG acquitted the applicant .
